com.esri.quickstart

Class EsriQuickStart

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.esri.android.map.MapView
          • com.esri.quickstart.EsriQuickStart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewGroup.OnHierarchyChangeListener, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class EsriQuickStart
extends com.esri.android.map.MapView
    A helper library for use with ArcGIS MapView and Android OS. Take advantage of this library to accelerate your application development cycles. It includes many helper methods for dealing with maps and basic graphics. It also has a built-in event bus to help you loosely couple the various components in your Activities.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Andy Gup

    • Constructor Detail

      • EsriQuickStart

        public EsriQuickStart(android.app.Activity activity,
              int mapId)
        A helper library for use with ArcGIS MapView and Android OS. Take advantage of this library to accelerate your application development cycles. It includes many helper methods for dealing with maps and basic graphics. It also has a built-in event bus to help you loosely couple the various components in your Activities.
        Parameters:
        activity - A reference to the primary Activity where the map will be displayed
        mapId - id the mapView in your primary layout xml file, e.g. (R.id.map);

    • Method Detail

      • addLayer

        public com.esri.android.map.ags.ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer addLayer(EsriQuickStart.MapType maptype,
                                                           java.lang.Double latitude,
                                                           java.lang.Double longitude,
                                                           java.lang.Double scale,
                                                           java.lang.Boolean visible)
        REQUIRED! Specifies a map from the choices listed in the Map enum.

        IMPORTANT: To swap layers use the setBaseMapVisibility() method.
        Parameters:
        maptype - the type of map as defined by the public enum Map
        latitude - center the map at this latitude. If null then library uses _DEFAULT_LAT.
        longitude - center the map at this longitude. If null then library uses _DEFAULT_LON.
        scale - sets the scale when the map first loads. If null then library uses _DEFAULT_SCALE.
        visible - if you add multiple layers then it's a best practice to have one layer set to visible at a time.
        Returns:
        ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer

      • setBaseMapVisibility

        public void setBaseMapVisibility(EsriQuickStart.MapType maptype)
        Allows you to toggle map visibility between MapType.STREETS,MapType.TOPO, and MapType.SATELLITE. Safe to use even if map layer is null.
        Parameters:
        maptype - The Map enum specifying which map will be visible.

        Returns:
        Boolean confirms the layer exists

      • findClosestGraphic

        public com.esri.core.map.Graphic findClosestGraphic(float x,
                                           float y,
                                           com.esri.android.map.GraphicsLayer graphicsLayer,
                                           int tolerance)
        Helper method that finds closest graphic based on a map click.
        Parameters:
        x - Float value of x from map click
        y - Float value of y from map click
        graphicsLayer - a reference to any GraphicsLayer being used by your app.
        tolerance - the tolerance in pixels. Recommended value is 25 or greater.
        Returns:
        Graphic returns null if no Graphic is found

                    com.esri.core.symbol.SimpleMarkerSymbol.STYLE style)
        Helper method that uses latitude/longitude points to programmatically draw a SimpleMarkerSymbol and adds the Graphic to map.
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        attributes -
        style - You defined the style via the Enum SimpleMarkerSymbol.STYLE

      • addGraphicLine

        public void addGraphicLine(java.lang.String[] lineArray,
                  com.esri.core.symbol.SimpleLineSymbol.STYLE style,
                  int color)
        Helper method uses latitude/longitude to programmatrically draw a simple, non-annotated line and add it to the map.
        Parameters:
        lineArray - a String Array containing "lat,lon" pairs.
        style - use SimpleLineSymbol.STYLE
        color - the color of the line. e.g. Color.BLUE

      • setDrawType

        public void setDrawType(EsriQuickStart.DrawType drawType)
        REQUIRED: Sets the DrawType for the draw functionality. Without this you will get a nullPointerException.

        NOTE: For more complex editing, such as editing attributes or points within a polygon see the Editing samples in the SDK
        Parameters:
        drawType -

      • startLocationService

        public void startLocationService()
        Performs safety checks before starting the LocationService. Should be limited to internal methods within the EsriQuickStartLib.
        It is almost always better to use delayedStartLocation() to guarantee that map is loaded first and LocationService has fully initialized and all its listeners have been enabled.
        Throws:
        LOCATION_EXCEPTION - if unable to shutdown the LocationService
        See Also:
        for thread safe starting after an Activity change

      • stopLocationService

        public void stopLocationService(java.lang.Boolean... silent)
        Stops LocationService. Checks if it is running first. Attempts 5 times to stop the service.
        Parameters:
        silent - OPTIONAL will prevent this method from dispatching shutdown events. Accepts null values.
        Throws:
        MapViewEventType.LOCATION_SHUTDOWN

      • getLastKnowLocation

        public android.location.Location getLastKnowLocation()
        Last known location taken from cache.
        Returns:
        Location this will be null if location not known.

      • delayedStartLocationService

        public void delayedStartLocationService(boolean... gpsSnapshotMode)
        Uses a Handler to delay the start of the location service until the base map has fully initialized. This is the preferred method when accessing this controller publicly. By default it will try 5 times to start(). If you don't do this, then you'll get nullPointerException when the location service attempts to plot a graphic on a non-existent map.
        Parameters:
        gpsSnapshotMode - OPTIONAL set to true if you want the GPS to settle down first before dispatching location event and then auomatically shutoff. Listen for event via MapViewEvent.LOCATION_UPDATE The shutdown threshold is determined by _DEFAULT_GPS_ACCURACY_RADIUS_METERS
        Throws:
        LOCATION_INITIALIZED - when LocationService is initialized but before start() is called.
        LOCATION_DELAYEDSTART_FAILURE - if unable to start LocationService.

      • isLocationEnabled

        public boolean isLocationEnabled()
        Determines whether or not location via GPS_PROVIDER or NETWORK_PROVIDER has been enabled on the device
        Returns:
        boolean

      • findAddressByXY

        public void findAddressByXY(float x,
                   float y)
        Helper method that finds an address by x and y. this is usually derived by a user clicking on the map and no conversion is needed.

        For example: public void onSingleTap(final float x, final float y) {...}

        Uses ReverseGeocoder which runs asynchronously. Listen for events via MapViewEvent.REVERSEGEOCODE_ADDRESS_COMPLETE internally and onAddressResultEvent externally.
        Parameters:
        x - a screen point
        y - a screen point
        See Also:
        dispatchGeocodeEvent, onAddressResultEvent

      • findAddressByLatLon

        public void findAddressByLatLon(double latitude,
                       double longitude)
        Helper method that finds an address by latitude and longitude. We use double to accommodate high-precision lat/lons.

        Uses ReverseGeocoder which runs asynchronously. Listen for events via MapViewEvent.REVERSEGEOCODE_ADDRESS_COMPLETE internally and onAddressResultEvent externally. *
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        See Also:
        dispatchGeocodeEvent, *

      • findAddress

        public void findAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Helper method that takes an address as input and then runs it through a Locator service.

        Uses AddressLocator which runs asynchronously. Listen for results via MapViewEvent.ADDRESS_COMPLETE and for exceptions via MapViewEvent.ADDRESS_EXCEPTION
        Parameters:
        address - Can be comma delimited or single line
